column1: slips this full delivery down leg in search of full swing, through to the keeper.
lunges forward and creams this square drive to point. Looks for the single but can't get it as he hit it too well.
shortens his length and angles one into middle and leg, tucked to fine leg to get off the mark
full, around the off-stump channel, nicely defended with soft hands.
full and swinging away from outside off, he's happy to leave.
squirts this into the gap between gully and point. Hint of movement, he shaped to drive, sliced it away in the end. First boundary of the morning.
short of length and swinging back into middle and leg, tucked towards midwicket
slants one across on off, hint of movement back in but not enough to make him play.
swings this down leg, looks to tickle but can't lay bat to it as it is way outside leg.
much better, makes him play forward to a full-length delivery that  bends back in slightly from outside off, defended into the leg side.
squeezes this attempted flick to short midwicket. Late inswing again for Southee, nicely played this time, albeit off a thick inside edge.

gone! Plays all around a length delivery that pitched on middle and off, looking to play cross-batted through midwicket but got his front foot right across. Dead duck the moment he missed it, the late inswing doing the trick. Gunathilaka is told by his partner in no uncertain terms to not review that. Good decision too.
off a thick edge past gully, but it will just be a single this time.
slants a length ball across Dhananjaya, who leaves.
floats this full and across the right-hander, defended solidly.
full and angled across again, Dhananjaya shoulders arms.
looks to squeeze this full delivery through cover point but gets an inside edge that bounces wide of the stumps.
off his hips and past short leg to get off the mark.
slightly shorter in length, gets it to move away off the seam from outside off, Dhananjaya gets on top of the bounce and defends gently.

squared up by late away movement and he gets a thin edge through to BJ Watling. Feet rooted to the crease as he feels for the ball that moves away in the air, at the point of contact, his right shoulder is visible, a great sign of him being in no control over the stroke, and the nick gleefully accepted. Southee on fire already.
attacks the stumps with a full delivery on middle, defended
flicks this full delivery on middle and leg to short midwicket

goes wide of the crease and bowls a half-volley on the pads in search of late swing, whipped nicely through midwicket. Ajaz gives it chase, pulls it back just before the ropes. Should've been three, poor running.

flicks this straight to short midwicket. What is happening! Ajaz takes a dolly. Southee went from wide of the crease to angle a full ball on middle, he looked to flick but only got it off the bottom to loop the simplest of catches.
slips a length ball back into the stumps, Karunaratne is off balance as he defends this into the leg side.
searches for late swing and in doing so, slips this down leg, through to the keeper.
stands tall and bunts this short of length delivery to point.
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone.
lovely drive down the ground. Slips this full full on the pads, eased away nicely past mid-on. Should make him feel better
shortens his length as he goes wide of the crease, tucked to the leg side, wide of midwicket for a single.
slips this length ball down leg, Mathews looks to tickle fine, gets some pad on it as it deflects to where short fine leg would be.
gets forward and defends this full delivery with his bat close to the pad.
overbalanced as he looks to tuck this through square leg, hit high on the pad.
full and swinging back into middle, defended back.
beaten on an adventurous pull that he looks to fetch from outside off, done in by the zip off the pitch.
solidly defended back towards the bowler
pushes him back with a shortish ball that Mathews jumps back and defends
short ball, goes over the front shoulder of Mathews as he ducks
length ball, angled across off, shuffles across and defends solidly
angles a length ball across and it's left alone
short of a length, pitching outside leg as he looks to close the face, and hits him high on the pad
back of a length,pitching outside leg, defended
good length outside off, gets forward and pushes through the off side
short of a length, just outside off, shuffles across and defends
good length, shaping away and finding the outside of the bat towards backward point
short of a length, cuts away outside off, carves a punch away but straight to point
full, curving into middle and off, wristily clipped past midwicket for a brace
nice shape away on this outswinger outside off, left alone
full, angled into middle, pushed along the ground to mid-on
length on off, defended from the crease
chases a long, long way away from the body as it swings away and beats the outside edge
short of good length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, gets forward and defends towards gully
gets on top of the bounce and punches this through point
short ball, angled in, gets under it
length ball, swings away outside off as he sticks the bat out and gets beaten
rips past the outside edge as it angles in and nips away off the seam, just past off stump
full on the pads, pushed away towards midwicket
swings away sharply to find the inside of the bat as he pushes forward and runs down the ground through the vacant mid-on region
length on off, tucked to the left of midwicket
fuller, angled across off, defended
full, pushed across off, defended
short ball, angled across off as he arches away
back of a length, pushed a long way across, left alone
back of a length, closer to off this time, shoulders arms again
length ball on off, turned away towards midwicket
full outside off, drilled to mid-on
glorious straight drive.. just leans forward into the shot to caress it away through long-off
angled across off and left alone
length on off, shuffles across and blocks. A wayward, neesless throw towards the keeper gives them an overthrow
full, angled across and holding its line, left alone
back of a length, angled across on off, defended
yorker on off, dug out down the ground
full outside off, drilled back off the inside of the bat
wayward short ball, pushed across with lots of width, slaps wildly at it but can't reach out
full, pushed across off, drilled away towards point
back of a length outside off, bunted back to the bowler
straight length ball, left alone
full outside off, defended
full, subtly swings away towards off, defended
sprayed on the pads, tries to nudge it away and the ball rolls away off the pad
full, angled close to off, he is sure of his off stump and lets it go
in the off-stump channel, some movement away, Mathews leaves
late on the back foot defence, the thick inside edge rolls into the leg side, behind the stumps.
floats this full on middle and leg, tucked away into the leg side. Mathews deep inside the crease as he made contact.
nice little drive back down the ground, Southee puts his hands out on his followthrough to stop that
banged in short, avoided. Flies to Watling, who has to leap high to collect that
right besides the line of this length delivery as he defends back.
Off a thick inside edge, races to the fine leg fence. Karunaratne played outside the line nearly, would've been plumb had he missed that.
lovely, this is much more convincing. Leans into the drive, plays a nice square drive into the gap. Thick outfield, so won't be a boundary.
floats full, invites the drive, but Karunaratne leaves
magnificent cover drive, nice stride forward to negate any movement there may be as he laces this into the gap between cover and mid-off. They're starting to grow in confidence now.
slants one back in on a length, just outside off, left alone.
angles back in a long way from outside off, squirted off a thick inside edge towards short midwicket
stands tall and bunts this short of length delivery into the off side.
lovely on-drive back past mid-on for a couple
slices this drive to cover point, where there's a misfield to give them a single.
pulls, but no timing on that, straight to square leg off the toe-end.
leans forward to lace this full delivery to mid-off.
swivels back and pulls but there's square leg, who is halfway back to the rope.
floated full on off from wide of the crease, defended gently.
slips this into middle and leg, tucked away towards fine leg.
lands it on a length outside off, defended back.
hint of width outside off, nibbling away, left alone.
feet rooted to the crease as de Grandhomme bowls a full delivery outside off, left alone.
chops this cut to point, not wide enough for him to play the stroke anyway.
hops across, expecting the short ball, and tucks this towards short leg.
width and he's belted this away into the gap at cover. Just pulls up before the ropes.
in the off-stump corridor, left alone.
slips this down leg and he tickles this away quite nicely to the fine leg boundary, raises Sri Lanka's 50.
dug in short but this is angling down leg, avoided without a hassle.
pulled in front of square, timed beautifully. Races to the midwicket boundary. 11 off Wagner's first over.
defends this full delivery on off from the crease, they squeeze through for a single as cover is caught napping.
angles one back in from round the stumps, bunted to point
shows the full face of the bat as he defends this back.
gets right behind the line as he punches this length delivery to point
play and a miss, beauty of a delivery! Feeling for the ball outside off, zips past the outside edge.

he's flicked this full toss straight to midwicket. De Grandhomme can't believe it, really. This is so juicy on the pads that as a batsman who expects hostile stuff, you dream of putting away. But hey, hey wait. Karunaratne has just been reprieved by a huuuuuuuuuuge no-ball. What a lucky break!
gets some inside edge onto the pad as he looks to flick this full delivery.
short ball, pitching outside leg, pulled to deep backward square
full outside off, gets forward and blocks
full outside off, leans forward into a push through mid-off
short ball, stays back and pulls through square leg
goes for a pull but the bounce is too much on this short ball
short of a length, angled in, tucked through square leg
full outside off, blocked into the covers
pings the pad as he tries to close the face but the angle in is too sharp
lets this go seeing the line it starts from, but the ball curves in a mile to nearly shave off stump
again, gets it to sharply angle in as it finds the inside of the bat as he presses forward to defend
full around off, driven back
full on off, drilled away to mid-on
short, pitching outside leg, barely has to duck
shortish, angled across from outside leg stump, pulled to square leg
short outside off, jumps back and blocks
controls a pull to this short ball to deep midwicket
short, angled in, ducked under
short, angled down leg, left alone
short of a length on off, defended back
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
too wide outside off to make him play
possible inside edge onto the pad as he curves this one in off a length
again pings the pad but it's hit him pretty high
short ball, pitching outside leg, ducked under
banged in short outside leg, swivel-pulls through backward square leg along the ground
short, angled in from around the wicket, ducked under
back of a length, angled in, backs away and knocks it to midwicket
length, angled in and nipping away, pokes loosely to get beaten
similar movement, goes away well outside off as he shoulders arms
back of a length, jags away outside off, left alone
fuller around off, driven to mid-on
full and tight outside off, defended
full and swinging away, reaches out and drills it down the ground for four
full and swinging away, reaches across and pushes it away to cover
full, swinging away, pushed away towards point
good length, swinging away, defended to point
full, nipping away, blocked off the outside of the bat towards point
length outside off, defended
short, swivel pulls to deep midwicket
huge shout for leg before, turned down. They don't review. Seems to be pitching in line but it has cut back in from a length to beat the flick. With Mathews walking across, could it have been close?
good length outside off, shuffles across and defends
full on the stumps, defended back
driven nicely to extra cover. This was pitched up, not much swing this time for Southee.
full but swings down leg this time, Karunaratne looks to tickle fine but can't get bat to it.
clips the pad on the way through to the keeper. Another full ball that he can't put away. Watling's half-hearted appeal was a giveaway that there was no bat involved.
neat clip off the pads this time, races to the fine leg boundary. Now, this is a peach to a right-hander, a juicy delivery to a left-hander.
works this off his pads to square leg for an easy single.
full around off, he gets half-forward and defends.
beauty that leaves him late. Looks to waft at this from the crease, whizzed past the outside edge.
nice and full delivery angling in from wide of the crease, defended back.
driven back firmly, but straight to mid-off.
straying into the pads, worked nicely into the gap at midwicket for a couple. Rolled his wrists nicely over the ball
attacks the stumps by bowling full from wide of the crease, defended back with soft hands.
swinging away from outside off, left alone.
invites the drive by pitching it up, left alone.
clips the pad and races past the diving Watling to the fine leg fence. Straying down leg from Southee
back of length outside off, left alone
gets this to swing away from full-length close to off-stump, Mathews plays inside the line as this zips through to the keeper.
full and swinging away from outside off again, left alone.
short of length outside off, Karunaratne gets on top of the bounce and defends.
beaten on the drive, chases a wide delivery by looking to play an expansive drive. Nearly bit the bait
full and moving away from around the fourth stump, left alone.
back of length delivery slanting away, watched through to the keeper.
gets on top of the bounce and tucks this into the leg side.
full and moving away a hint from the off stump, left alone
wanted to drive, then leave but by the time he pulled out, this had rolled off the toe-end to third slip. Uncertainty from Mathews

not controlled and he gets away with this! Top-edge that flies into the fine leg boundary. Looking to fetch the pull from outside off, got big on him, was beaten for pace as well but went through with the stroke. Lucky runs, but Southee shouldn't mind that as a bowler.
solid in defence of this full delivery angled in from wide of the crease.
shortens his length and angles this on middle, defended back.
bowls full on off, shows the full face of the bat to defend.
gets half-forward and dabs this into the off side.
squirts the drive into the gap between cover and point, by no means a full-blooded drive but nicely played nonetheless.
turns this short of length delivery into the body to the midwicket region
slices this drive on the bounce to backward point.
driven firmly down to mid-on.
nips back in from wide of the crease, cramps him for room and thuds into the thigh pad as he looks to whip this square. This was bowled at 144kph
steers this short of length delivery outside off towards the gully region.
once again the uncertainty exposes Mathews' weakness. This one nearly rolled back off a thick inside edge onto the stumps. Down to fine leg
angles one full outside off, left alone
edged and this flies past second slip! This is superb bowling. Late swing back in , pitched and then held its line. Karunaratne looks to flick but gets a thick edge.
too short, on middle and leg, tucked away to deep midwicket. Half-century for Karunaratne
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone.
defends this full delivery with his bat close to the pad.
shortens his length, gets this to zip off the deck from outside off, left alone
squared up but he somehow manages to block this full delivery that tails away from middle.
zips through to whizz past the thigh pad to the keeper.
reaches out to bunt this attempted drive to short cover. Hint of risk with that as Boult is getting it to move away late.
hurried him into this defensive jab, off a thick outside edge to third slip. Managed to keep it down but he was hustled for pace
slips this on the pads, flicked to short midwicket
short of a length, nudged into the on side
fuller, pushed across outside off, drilled towards mid-off
full and straight on the stumps, driven back
short ball, pushed across and giving him room, controls a pull through backward square leg, along the ground
short outside off, fetches a pull from outside off and crunches it to deep midwicket
full outside off, defended back
full, angled into leg, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket. Boult has been surprisingly erratic today
fullish, runs off the inside edge to deep fine leg
length ball, slanted across on off, tucked to deep square leg
full, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
stinger. Nasty short ball, hurries onto Karunaratne, who takes his eyes off and cops a blow on the lower half of the front arm
full, swinging away, pushed to mid-off
full around off, driven straight down the ground. Easily done and brings up the 100 of the stand
full and swinging away, left alone
back of a length, nudged with the angle to deep fine leg
angling in but fired from wide of the crease as it beats the outside edge
shortish, wide, rocks back and carves a punch away to deep point
almost chipped back. Short of a length, stays back and checks his backfoot push, drops short of the bowler to his front
short of a length, angled across off, swings wildly at it and misses
length ball on off, punched towards midwicket
short of a length around off, whipped away to deep square
length ball that jags away late and runs past the second slip off the outside edge. NZ continue to find movement
fuller of a length on off, blocked to point
full outside off, driven to extra cover
length outside off, 124.7ks, defended
swivel-pulls a short ball to deep square
tails in from a fuller length and from pretty wide outside off, left alone
slashes at the sight of some width but doesn't get enough bounce as he gets beaten
short and wide, cut away through the gap at cover
full outside off, defended towards mid-off
clips a fuller one off the pads through square leg
fuller, jags away from outside off, covers the line and blocks to point
back of a length outside off, punched between cover and point
pushed a long way across, left alone
short of a length, angles away and cuts him in half as it shoots past the outside edge
full, curving in, pushed off the inside of the bat to mid-on
extremely full outside off, drilled into the covers
pitched up outside off, pushed down the ground to mid-off
full, straight and wide outside off, left alone
angles into him from wide of the crease and he leans into a drive to cover
short and wide, cut behind point
full and swinging away from outside off, Karunaratne gets to the pitch of the ball and defends.
this is a inswinger that comes back in wickedly from wide of the crease, Karunaratne is thrown off balance as he looks to bring his bat down to tuck it square. He's saved by a thin inside edge
controls this neat little tuck wide of short midwicket for a quick single.
reaches out and caresses this full delivery to extra cover.
slants one full on off from wide of the crease, defended back.
length, much closer to off stump, defended back.
rocks back and cuts late to beat backward point. This was too short, and it's bread and butter for Mathews, who brings up his half-century
nice and full on off, eased with the spin to mid-off.
spins away from off stump, defended.
tossed up on off stump, he lunges forward and smothers this nicely.
too full, once again easily defended.
steps out and looks to whip it over mid-on but is nearly beaten by the drift, just falls short of short midwicket. Good bowling, the best delivery of that over.
banged in short on middle, Karunaratne ducks under this one
gets hit on the stomach as this short ball thuds into his body, kept a touch low even as he decided to take him on with the pull shot.
glorious pull, in superb control as he swivels back and picks the gap at deep square leg. Didn't bother keeping it down because there was no one inside the ring. Lovely timing and placement.
gets on top of the bounce and pulls this down to fine leg.
slants a full delivery across, defended.
squeezes this full delivery into the off side with soft hands.
nice flight but this is too full, defended back by Karunaratne
shortens his length, gets this to spin back in but Karunaratne is right behind the line in defence
delicate little glide past short third man, using the pace to play this for runs. Pulled back in just before it crossed the ropes.
drifts in and gets this to straighten from round the stumps, Mathews blocks.
touch too full on middle, blocked.
works this off his pads towards deep midwicket.
zips a length ball across the right-hander, left alone.
works this off his pads towards the man coming in from deep square. Wagner slips in his followthrough as the boot comes off.

the 133-run stand has been broken! big wicket against the run of play and it's the short-ball tactic that has played mind games on Karunaratne. Looks to be ultra-aggressive, wants to take him on with the pull even though there were two fielders set for the pull, he manages to simply glove this through to Watling down the leg side. Huge wicket, huge moment in the game. It's that war horse who has delivered a timely breakthrough for New Zealand.
tucks this away nicely off his hip to square leg to get off the mark
full and swinging back into the pads, clipped neatly to the fine leg boundary.
squirts this full delivery into the off side with soft hands.
full and moving away off the seam from outside off, left alone
slips this full delivery on the pads, tucked gently to square leg.
shoulders arms to a full delivery moving away a hint from outside off.
invites the drive by pitching it up, but Chandimal leaves.
full, just outside off, this one nips back in a hint but Chandimal defends solidly.
lovely drive, but straight to short cover.
floats this full on off from wide of the crease, punched to mid-off.
neat clip off his pads to the fine leg boundary. This was starting from leg, moved back in so a safe shot under the circumstances.
flicks this towards mid-on where de Grandhomme puts in a dive to keep it down to a single.
dug in short, this rises way over the batsman's head as he ducks under it.
rises to play a short-arm jab from outside off towards deep square leg.
full and angling away from the right-hander, left alone
short of a length outside off, punched to cover
length ball, angled into middle, shuffles across and blocks
full outside off, moves across and defends
full, swinging away, reaches out and carves it away to the left of sweeper cover
length ball outside off, defended to point
short of second slip. Pushes away from the body and gets a thick outside edge but is lucky to survive
angles in a short ball that's pulled to square leg diving to his right
full, angled across the fifth-stump channel, shoulders arms
full on off, blocked to cover
full, angled across off, driven to extra cover
short ball, gets under it easily as it angles over middle and off
short around off, gets up on his toes and manages to nudge it away into the on side
short and angled in, tries to pull but gets cramped for room and misses out
full outside off, gets forward and defends into the covers
just back of a length on off, stays in the crease and defends
gets a stride across to a fuller one and blocks towards backward point
short, well-directed around the off-stump channel, Chandimal arches out of the way
full on off, driven to mid-off
full, curves into him late, closes the face but skews it back to the bowler off the outer part of the bat
short of a length, slanted across off, whipped against the line to midwicket
short, pitching outside leg, ducked under
short ball, sitting up nicely outside off, rocks back and comfortably pulls over midwicket
length, angled across off, left alone
back of a length, slanted across off, whipped to square leg
back of a length around off, gets on top of the bounce and drops it to midwicket
short on off, no room and he has to arch a long way back to get out of the line
short, climbs onto him around middle and leg, pings the helmet grille as he tries to keep it out
short ball again, barely manages to get on top of it as he keeps it down in front of forward short leg
persists with the length but this one's angled down leg
shortish, just outside off, gets up on his toes and blocks into the off side
full, angled across outside off, carefully reaches out and pushes to cover
full, angled across off, drilled down the ground, over the back of Wagner as he tumbles on the followthrough
short of good length outside off, shuffles across and jabs it straight back to Wagner
angles a fuller one into off, clipped to midwicket
short outside off, stays away from it and pokes at it to defend into the surface
short, makes contact with it outside off as he gently pulls it without any followthrough of the bat through midwicket
back of a length, punched to point and is sent back as he looks for a quick one
short around off, easily gets under it
short on the middle stump channel, nudged behind square for a single
flays a pull to this short ball but straight to square leg
short again, this time he swivels through to pull it behind square to the sweeper at the boundary
shortish, goes over Chandimal's arched back as he gets under it
slips in a length delivery on middle, defended back.
right behind the line as he defends this length ball that nips back in
angles one across, too full, played back with soft hands.
defends with his bat close to the pad. Nice shape, hint of movement away with the angle Boult creates from wide of the crease.
ducks under this short ball that sails over Mathews' head as he ducks under it.
plants fully forward and defends into the covers.
short of length aimed at his ribcage but Chandimal somehow manages to get on top of the bounce and fend it away
he's fallen to the short-ball plan. Hit straight down the throat of Ajaz Patel at deep square leg. Very poor from Sri Lanka's captain. Lack of fight against New Zealand's tried and tested plan.
pulled away towards deep backward square.
sways out of the line of this short ball that is angled across
gets right on top of the bounce and tucks this gently into the leg side.
slips this length ball down leg, Dickwella misses the neat tickle towards fine leg.

another mistimed hook, but this one sails over the short fine-leg boundary. Ajaz Patel was in business just for a split second but this sailed over. Mathews got into position nice and early, premeditated stroke.
plays the short-arm jab down to Ajaz at fine leg this time
slips in a full and straight delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, squeezed to mid-on.
delightful punch on the up through extra cover, two men giving it chase and they scamper back for the third.
length ball, angling down leg, tries to glance it away but makes no contact
short ball, pitching outside leg, swivel-pulls and gets a glove past the keeper to fine leg
turned into the leg side for a single

huge wicket and it's the well-set Mathews who has now been undone by the short ball. This is cleverly angled away from round the stumps in such a way that Mathews is cramped for room as he looks to take on the short ball, in the process can only glove this to Watling who leaps high to grab this. They're falling apart quite spectacularly here to a plan that New Zealand have not tried to hide
banged in short outside off, he ducks under this.
slips this back of length delivery down leg, left alone.
half-volley on the pads, flicked to long leg for an easy single.
dug in short from over the wicket but Dilruwan ducks under this without much hassle.
squirts this fullish delivery into the gully region.
thick outside edge, races into the gap between third slip and gully. Feet rooted to the crease as he throws his bat at this away-going delivery. Streaky runs.
shoulders arms to a short of length delivery angling away
squeezes this full delivery back towards the bowler.
off the pad, lobs to Watling's right as he dives to grab this. Replays confirm a healthy inside-edge onto the pad on its way to the keeper.
gets onto his toes and whips this to deep backward square leg. Dickwella wanted the second, but is sent this.
right on top of the bounce as he defends
dug in short, Dilruwan ducks
hops back and across to fend this lifter. Excellent bowling
slips this full and into the pads, tucked away nicely towards deep backward square leg. Aggressive running to complete the second.
banged in short on middle from wide of the crease, avoided without much hassle
nips away off a fuller length and runs away through backward point off the outside of the bat
short of good length, angling into leg, tucked off the hips to midwicket
short ball, climbing on him at leg stump, drops it into the leg side from his toes
beauty from Boult! Full, curving in and threatening to be heading towards the stumps and then swinging away sharply to rip past the outside edge
pulls a short ball not with full control to deep backward square
full, angled across, pushed towards gully who stops it with a dive
short, middle and off lines, pulled behind square
short of a length, nudged into the on side
shortish, down leg, tries to tuck it off the hips and misses
short ball, banged in around the wicket, climbs over his front shoulder as he ducks
full, angled into middle and off, driven straight down the ground, past mid-off's right
short of a length, slower at 124.6ks, ducks under it
back of a length, tucked off the pads very fine, past the fielder in the deep
this one's even better. Full and swinging away, leans into a drive and works it away through backward point
short ball on middle, drops it into the pitch
full on off, swinging away, pushed off the front foot into the covers
short of a length, attacking off stump, shuffles across to cover it and defends
full, angling into middle and leg, driven down the ground, to mid-on's right
short of good length outside off, shuffles across and defends
full outside off, leans forward and blocks
pushes forward to a fuller one and eases it away through cover and point
full around off, gets forward to drive but the ball tails in, grabs the inside edge, and smashes into the pad
caught in two minds as he plays at it and then withdraws the bat. Too late, though, as he gets an edge off the bottom of the bat. Lucky not to have chopped on
pushes forward into a drive through the covers
short, pitching outside leg, ducked under
full outside off, defended
short of a length, angled away, left alone
pitched up outside off, good stride across as he crunches a drive through point
very full around off again, controlled push down the ground for a brace
full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length, angled in, tucked to square leg
pushed across outside off, left alone
full, angled across, driven to cover
big swing and a miss as it tails away from him with the angle
good length on off, defended
full outside off, driven to extra cover

outstanding from Henry Nicholls! What anticipation. Lakmal runs out of patience as he looks to pull a short ball angling away, but something stops him from doing so fully. But by then its too late so the ball lobs into the leg side. Now, Nicholls starts to take off from short leg as he turns back, but isn't helped by the fact that he is looking upwards to track the trajectory with the helmet on his head. So he now trusts his agility and speed to get him close to the ball. He sprints, gets close to the ball and as it comes down, he puts out a full-length dive to reach it. play and a miss. Looks to flay this on the up through cover.

driven firmly to extra cover.
cuts back in sharply from outside off, left alone. Wasn't far from off stump.
crisp drive, but straight to extra cover.
driven on the up past the cover region.

doesn't commit himself fully forward, adjusts to the length superbly as he defends from the crease.
slips this full delivery on leg stump, tucked to midwicket
right besides the line as he punches this wide of point for a single.
squeezes this full-length delivery back to the bowler.
width and he's cut that away towards deep point to raise New Zealand's 200
goes right back into the crease to bunt this into the leg side.
turns this gently towards mid-on for a quick single
slants one across the right-hander, left alone.
feet planted fully forward as he drives, but can't pierce mid-off.
driven back past the bowler, mid-off comes around to cut that off.

drifting into middle, pushed back.

driven on the up, into the gap at extra cover.
cracking cut shot, but straight to deep point
clipped to fine leg for an easy single.
makes a hint of room and punches this into the gap at extra cover
drifts into middle, punched to deep cover this time

would you believe what has just happened? Williamson fails to keep this sweep down and has toe-ended this straight to backward square leg. Williamson will be livid with himself, a century was there for the taking and he's just missed out bigtime.
gets this to drift away from round the stumps, Taylor lunges forward and blocks.
gets forward and across as he defends this back towards the bowler.
squirts this off a thick outside edge past slip, Taylor turned blindly for the second, just as well that they didn't complete it.
full outside off, defended back

pushes a fuller one back

pitched up on middle, defended
slider, on a length and on leg stump, tucked to midwicket
slides a length ball across, flatter trajectory, defended back

sliding into middle and leg, defended
advances down the ground and clips a full toss to mid-on
pulls a short one without any control but luckily for him it drops short of deep square leg running forward
full outside off, gets forward and defends into the off side
full, angling into leg, clipped behind deep square leg
full outside off, driven through cover
full, given lots of room and he opens up to crunch a drive to cover
gets forward and blocks into the off side
advances down the ground and tries to clip it away but wears it on the pad

short, tries to cut but the bounce isn't quite there and he misses

dropped at a wide first slip by Dhananjaya! Taylor gets a reprieve. Chased a full and wide delivery that swung away late to get a thick edge, the fielder may have reacted a split-second late. Would've been the perfect tonic late in the day.
nips back in from length outside off, defended back.
back of length delivery angling into the stumps, defended back
tight line - full, much closer to the stumps, defended with his bat close to the pad.
crisp drive to a full delivery, straight to extra cover.
firm push straight to mid-off.

length outside off, hint of movement away, steered wide of point for a single.

short delivery outside leg, Taylor swivels back and helps this along to the fine leg boundary. Swung around, got on top of the ball and played it all along the ground. Desperate dive by the fielder in the deep, but he dived over the ball.
tucked away towards fine leg for an easy single.
ducks under this short ball outside leg.

appeal for lbw as he's hit on the thigh pad, but this one pitched way outside leg.

works this off his legs to deep square leg.
attacks the stumps with a length ball on middle and leg, tucked to fine leg
length ball on middle, hint of movement away, defended back down the pitch.

crunching cover drive, had to really stretch to make it, but he's lucky there's no direct hit. What's more, there's an overthrow at the bowler's end and Latham hurries across the turf to raise his 7th Test century. He breaks a century drought that has lasted 11 Tests. His previous, a pristine 177, was also here against Bangladesh in January last year. The runs also raise the 50-stand.
gets right forward and blocks this length delivery moving away.

Terrific reflex catch
length ball fairly wide of off stump, left alone

fullish, angling into a fifth-stump line. Left alone
nice length, a touch shorter than the previous one, slightly closer to off stump. Latham judges it well and leaves again

again a pretty full length, quite a bit wider this time, hoping to entice a drive away from the body. Latham will have nothing to do with it

back of a length on off stump, stops a little bit. Goes back and across and punches with a nice, straight bat, wide of mid-on
back of a length, close to off stump, punched to mid-off

fuller now, good stride out to drive to cover point
short ball over off stump, gets up to waist height. Pulled round to deep square leg

driven into the covers off the back foot and the man at short extra sprints quickly to his right and puts in a dive to stop the ball

flighted length ball, defended with the turn into the covers

flighted ball wide of off stump, stretches out to defend with an open face to backward point
back of a length close to off stump, punched firmly back towards the bowler
shortish, stops on Nicholls and doesn't turn. Wants to make room to cut, but can only stab it back down the ground, towards mid-off
length ball pitching on middle and off and continuing to leave the left-hander with the angle. Left alone
back of a length now, similar angle away from off stump. Left alone
shortish, close to off stump. Gets on his toes to jab towards cover
lovely length, slanting across to off stump. Latham wants to drive down the ground, ends up getting a thick edge that rolls through the covers
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone
length ball close to off stump, blocked into the on side
flighted leg-stump ball from over the wicket, clipped round the corner to short fine leg

nicely bowled. Gets a bit of drift in to the left-hander to cause the ball to straighten and cramp Latham for room as he goes back, looking to open up the cover region. Forced to punch it back to the bowler
fuller now, defended back to the bowler off the front foot
down the track to the flighted leg-stump ball, driven to long-on

there's the breakthrough, finally. Jumps out of his crease to this nicely flighted ball, and I think he's been done in by the drift here. He was looking to hit it back over the bowler's head, but the ball drifted inwards, pitched on a line closer to him than he expected, forcing him to hit it a little further into the on side, off the inside half of the bat, and long-on takes a smart catch running to his right
nice flight on leg stump, stretches out to defend, smothering the spin
full on off stump, punched back firmly to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
short outside off, angling in from wide of the crease, left alone
full, angling into a fourth-stump line, driven to mid-off
bouncer over off stump, Watling ducks low to get under it

ooh, is that off the bat or the helmet? Bat is the umpire's decision, and Watling isn't arguing. That's a nasty bouncer, keeps coming in with the angle, and you'll have to say Watling dealt poorly with that, taking his eyes off the ball and turning his head away as he ducked, while leaving his bat up like a periscope. The ball hit the back of the bat and popped up in the air to offer Dickwella the simplest of catches
length ball pitching outside leg, defended unto the on side

sharp chance!. Length ball outside off and CdG goes for the on-the-up drive. Doesn't turn as much as he expects and he sends a thick edge flying to the left of gully, Karunaratne, who doesn't get his hands out to his left in time to catch it
lands this a bit closer to off stump, clipped with the turn to midwicket
tossed up fuller and wider, driven to extra-cover
there's the drifter outside off. Keeps sliding away off the pitch after beginning to drift away in the air. Left alone
fullish outside off, slanting away, defended into the point region
length ball angling across to off stump, presses forward and defends gently wide of short extra-cover to pick up a quick single
overpitched, angling into off stump, and CdG shows the full face to send it racing away past the non-striker's right foot
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and defends to backward point
another bouncer, rises up high over off stump, CdG ducks under it
Back of a length, angling into leg stump, tucked away to deep square leg
tossed up nicely outside off, a bit of away-drift too. Gets nicely forward to defend into the covers
a touch shorter, goes back to punch into the covers
lovely length, again gets a bit of drift away before pitching and turning back in. Presses forward and squeezes out a defensive push back to the bowler
flatter and shorter, goes back to punch to long-on
length ball from over the wicket, pitching on middle stump. Stays leg-side of the ball and punches into the covers
tossed up fuller just outside leg stump, defended towards short leg
bouncer, rising over off stump, de Grandhomme ducks under it
another bouncer, this one doesn't rise as high. De Grandhomme is forced into an uncomfortable-looking squat to get under it
overpitched, on middle and off, clipped away to the left of deep square leg
another bouncer, over middle stump, Latham ducks, lets it pass over his back
digs it in again, this time angles it across towards off stump. Latham chooses to sway this time
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away through midwicket
punches a back of a length delivery to the right of mid-off and sets off on a rapid single
spins in from a length, tucked off the pads through square leg.. easy-peasy!
short of a length, spinning in towards off, punched down to long-on for one
pitched up on leg stump, turned away to square leg for one
flat and full outside off, leans forward and defends
a bit of loop and skiddy turn outside off, kept out on the front foot
short of a length, pushed across on off, opens the face for a single through backward point
fuller, tails into hi, helps it along with a clip to deep midwicket
fuller of a length, zero movement outside off, left alone
fuller outside off, driven to cover
fuller of a length on off, defended
length ball that keeps a little low outside off, kept out from the crease
back of a length, spinning away, punched to mid-off
comes down the track, close to the turn and pushes it to extra cover
full on off, pushed back to Perera
short of a length, whipped off the hips to midwicket
tossed up outside off, drilled down to long-on
meets a low, dipping full toss with a foray down the ground but finds square leg as he clips it off the pads
has he nicked off here? No, but so so close! Reaches out to a very full and wide delivery, some noise as the ball goes past the edge but the bat hit the turf
more nerves as there's a yes and no on the second after turning this one away square on the leg side
short and wide, chops a cut to point
short ball, angled down leg, ducked under
goes full now and de Grandhomme clips uppishly to the right of mid-off who moves across and intercepts it with a dive
full, angled across, left alone
back of a length, flat and slid across, whipped to midwicket
full, slanted across around off, jabbed back to the bowler
tucks a length ball straight to square leg
now he finds the gap between midwicket and square leg as he clips this fuller one
full, curving into leg, defended into the off side on the front foot
moves to 98 and keeps strike wit this gentle push down to long-on
short of a length, tucked off the pads to deep midwicket... 199
all the way for six as he rocks back and pulls this short ball forcefully from around off to over deep backward square
six more.. banged in too short, doesn't matter if it's angled in pretty sharply, still comes on well enough to fly off the bat with whatever contact he manages
length ball, defended down the pitch
short of a length, angled in, whipped off the pads to deep square leg
misses out.. a harmless length ball on leg stump, closes the face but the ball hits the pad off the inside edge
back of a length, tucked off the pads to deep midwicket.. turns the strike back over to Latham

there it is.. the double-century. Latham's maiden in Test cricket. Whips the helmet off and soaks in a rich applause. Gets there by clipping a fuller one through midwicket. This has been a clinic on Test match batting. Terrific knock
turns this fuller one away into the on side
slides a fuller one across and works it towards the third man region with an open face
pushes a fuller one across, defended off the front foot
full around off, pushed back
back of a length, leg stump line, tucked away to square leg
short ball outside off, stays deep in the crease and heaves away a mighty pull over deep square leg.. declaration coming soon?
full around off, drilled towards mid-on
short, bit of width, cut to point
short of a length on the pads, tucked away to deep midwicket
length ball, turned away behind square off the pads
pitched up on off, driven down to long-on
full on middle, whipped powerfully off the pads to midwicket
nudges this fuller one away behind square leg
comes down the ground and clips this to deep square.. vacant spaces there so they get two
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
leg-side lines again, turned away to backward square
floats up a full toss that's driven to deep cover
slants it across full outside off, defended
fuller on the pads, flicked to midwicket
full, sliding in, tucked fine for one
slants it across outside off, front-foot defense to point
full outside off, pushed into the covers
turns this away into the on side
advances down to the pitch and crunches a drive through extra cover, mid-off cuts it off to his right
muscles a fuller one to long-on
length, spins away, shifts back and defends back
length, curving into off, drilled off the backfoot to mid-on

holes out to deep midwicket! Comes down the ground and uses his powerful wrists to whip it away off the pads. Just doesn't manage as much power this time, gets just about enough elevation and distance to carry and settle into the hands of Rajitha diving forward
shuffles across to defend a length ball in front of off
back of a length outside off, punched to point
short ball, sitting up nicely and he rocks back to comfortably pull it away through midwicket
switches back to a fuller length and drives to cover
full, curving in late from wide outside off, left alone
full, tails in from wide outside off, left alone
shortish on off, backs away and drops it in front of point for one
on the shorter side and pushed across outside off, jumps and keeps it out on the off side
short of good length around the fifth-stump channel, strides across and defends solidly to point
short, angled across on middle and off, pulled to deep midwicket
short and a bit of seam away, arches out of the line and lets it pass
short of good length, angled in, whipped to deep backward square
stays leg side of this fuller ball and drills it with force towards mid-off
opens up for a pull to a short ball that doesn't get up to his anticipation and gets an under edge that's intercepted by the keeper diving to his left
back of a length, angled in, defended off the backfoot.. no-ball called because of an extra fielder behind square on the leg side
short around off, pulls it to deep midwicket on the bounce
length ball, tailing in from wide of the crease, Latham is sure of his off stump and lets it go
full outside off, leans forward into a drive to mid-off
tucks a length ball to deep midwicket
loopy flighted ball, skips down the leg side
flighted on middle, turned away towards midwicket
full and flat on leg, drilled down to long-on
back of a length, slanted across off, punched to point off the backfoot
floats up a full toss that's slapped down to long-off
spins away from a length outside off, punched through point
exquisitely played down the ground.. Very full and all he has to do is lean forward with his weight behind the drive
around a length outside off, comes forward and defends to point
fuller around middle, gets behind it and defends
back of a length, angled into off, defended off the backfoot
full, leaves him late but it's too wide to make him play in the first place
good length just outside off, shuffles across and blocks solidly
slid into middle from around the wicket, gets forward and blocks
stays back and tucks a length ball to midwicket
short of a length, spinning away, cut to deep point
full, slid across on middle, defended
flat and sliding into middle, pushed back to the bowler

has there been a run out here? Oh yeah, comfortably gone. Perera pushes this one further across off, Southee pushes it towards mid-off and takes off for a single. Took a chance there and he has been felled by a direct hit
Short, as expected, and Wagner sways away from the line
dug in once more, well outside off though. Left alone
short, rising ball angling into the batsman's throat. Gets on his toes, rides the bounce nicely, and drops it into the off side with soft hands. Came off the glove, I think
full, angling down leg. Can't connect with the flick
well-directed bouncer, rising just about head height on a stump-to-stump line. Wagner keeps his eye on it and ducks down low

the short-ball tactic has worked. Awkward bouncer, rising towards Wagner's front shoulder, and he tries to fend it away into the leg side. Only manages to pop it up in an unintended direction, off glove - I think - and it balloons into the hands of the fielder at wide slip
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
flat length ball fairly wide of off stump, left alone
floated up slow, angling into the pads, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, goes with the angle towards off stump, punched to long-on
length ball angling in towards off stump, clipped to midwicket
goes slightly wider and angles a length ball in towards middle and off. Plays around his front pad to clip towards leg gully
length ball angling into off stump, presses forward for the gentle push into the covers
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
bouncer slanting across Ajaz, who does well to sway away from the line with his eyes on the ball. It didn't rise as much as he may have expected
another bouncer, this one climbs much higher and Ajaz sways and leaves it more comfortably
another bouncer, over off stump, Ajaz sways away once again
Looks for the yorker and gets his length right, but the line is down the leg side and it forces Dickwella into a full-length dive to his right
tossed up full on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
ooh, sharp turn. Back of a length outside off and Ajaz plays down the wrong line in defence
length ball angling into the pads, worked away through backward square leg
tossed up slow outside off, driven to long-off
full on the pads, clipped to the left of midwicket

length ball, fairly flat, angling into middle stump and straightening. Defends it back to the bowler, unconvincingly. Didn't really get a stride in, and got opened up a bit, bat coming down at an angle and only its outside half making contact with the ball
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, punched to the right of extra-cover. Refuses the single that was available
length ball slanting across to off stump, defended firmly into the covers
wide length ball, left alone
back of a length outside off, steered down to third nan with an open face
attempted bouncer, slanting across to off stump. Ajaz tries to sway, but his bat is in the line, and he ends up steering the ball past the fielder at gully
full outside off, driven to deep cover
down the track and he can't quite reach the pitch as Dilruwan slows this down on off stump. Clipped to midwicket
tossed up close to off stump, presses forward and blocks into the covers
down the track and Dilruwan shortens his length again. The line is on the pads, and he works it away through square leg
big appeal as this one slides on with the angle and Ajaz misses the ball, playing around his front pad. Was probably angling down leg
another appeal for lbw, similar delivery and response - this time, there was a thick inside edge onto pad
length ball close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, uses the pace and angle to guide it down to third man
full and wide and that's a crunching drive from Lathan to beat sweeper cover running to his left at the boundary
shorter now, some width again, and Latham cuts to backward point
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
short outside off, stabbed away to third man
attempted bouncer, angling across the left-hander, hardly gets up at all, just about stomach height as Ajaz sways away from the line
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
back of a length, goes with the angle from round the wicket. Ajaz goes deep in his crease to work it through square leg
down the track, not quite to the pitch of this flatter one on off stump, defended
sees him coming and bowls it much shorter and a little wider. Flat-batted to extra-cover
shortish and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
ooh. Looks to slog-sweep this, clearing his front leg and sinking onto his back knee. Ball slides on with the angle and he inside-edges into his pad
short of good length, pitching outside leg, tucked behind square leg
reaches out to a fuller one and pushes it through extra cover
short of a length, pitching outside leg, tucked to square leg
full on middle, clipped to deep midwicket for a brace
length ball outside off, punched towards point for one

Sri Lanka claim a catch Not given by the umpire and we have a review. Super b short ball, Ajaz is completely tucked up and is forced to bend over backwards awkwardly. But in doing so, he fails to keeps the hands down. Has there been a trickle on the glove? Almost nothing on Hot Spot but snicko seems to suggest there's glove on it. Difficult one for the third umpire. They zoom in on the glove but it's too hard to make out. Not conclusive enough to overturn the on-field decision. Seems to have hit the bottom glove off the handle
dances down to the pitch and gives this a good whack to the straight boundary
very full outside off, reverse-paddled to the third man region
comes down the track and pushes this into the off side
gets down for a big wild slog but this one's flat, curves in and pretty much goes on with the arm to not afford him the room. Not much bounce as well and he gets cleaned up
full and straight on middle and leg, defended
short of good length, pitching outside leg, pushes back for the second after tucking it behind square.. NZ's 550 comes up
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket.. 249
ah, well done.. nicely handled by Boult. As expected, it's been banged in without giving him roon but Boult backs away, arches back and ramps it over the gully region

that's a more audactious shot. Imperiously pulls this short one towards the long-on boundary. Wants to give Latham the strike and stretches forward full tilt, tumbles over for his efforts to give Latham a shot at 250
pulls this short one to the right of deep backward square, comes back for the second for a magnificent 250. Is there a bowler on the planet who can get him out today? What an innings!
clips this fuller one to deep midwicket
comes down the ground and tries to forcefully whip it away without success
down the ground and pummeled to long-on who after getting around it
left alone outside off
gets down and slogs this with the angle over deep midwicket.. too easy now
leans into a drive to point
length outside off, defended
short of good length, tucked away to deep midwicket
backs away to a full toss and tonks it down the ground
short ball, backs away and swats at it looking for a pull. He's not holding any sort of shape as he almost falls over attempting the shot. Gets a top edge that is snaffled by the keeper
full, swinging away, left alone
good length on off, defended
full, on leg stump, pushed to mid-on
short ball, angled across, a bit of movement away, arches out of the way
length, angled across off, defended
short of good length, moves off the deck, reaches out for a gentle dab through the covers
length, angling into leg, tries to tuck and misses. wears it on the pad
good length, swinging away, left alone
full, swings away, pushed into cover for a quick one
short of good length outside off, shuffles across and defends
short of a length, angling into off, defended off the backfoot
back of a length, pushed through on middle, defended back
short, pitching outside leg, ducked under
length, angled across, left alone
back of a length, pitching outside leg, tucked to square leg
short, doesn't control his pull as it goes off the glove towards square leg. stays in the air before dropping safely
full, pushed across off stump, left alone
angled into the pads, clipped to deep square leg
short of a length on off, shuffles across and defends

umpire Tucker grants Boult an lbw appeal but Gunathilaka reviews. Full and angling in, going past the closed face of the bat. No inside edge, so we wait for ball-tracking. It straightens just before hitting the pads and that means it's smashing into middle. Review lost
drills a fuller one down the pitch
back of a length, tails back in and heads down leg
short of a length, shuffles across and defends in front of off
shortish, turns around and pulls into the gap between square leg and midwicket
fuller on middle and leg, defended
short of a length on middle, knocks it to midwicket off the inside edge
length ball, holds its line, left alone outside off
straight through. Cross-seamer, lands on a length and moves in to go past the inside edge as de Silva prods forward and takes out his stumps. SL in deep trouble
full, swinging away, left alone
full, nips away, leans into a drive to cover
shortish, angled into middle, on his toes as he drops it behind point
length around off, susses out the straight line and lets it go
full outside off, leans forward and pushes it down the ground, past mid-off's right
short ball, angled across and he lets it pass
short of good length outside off, keeps a tad low but he manages to bring the bat down and defend

that's a horrible shot to play. Short, that was always the plan. Karunaratne needlessly swings at it, looking for an ambitious pull. Trying to hit his way out perhaps. Top-edged to deep backward square. The best day for batting and SL have lost three in six overs
keeps a length ball out off the backfoot
yorker, angled in to middle, dug out
good length on off, defended off the backfoot
full, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
short of length, down leg, tries to tuck it away and misses
shortish on middle and off, defended to midwicket
full outside off, leans into a drive to mid-off
short, moves across and nudges behind square for one
shuffles across and keeps it out towards point
tucked off the pads to midwicket
full, a hint of away movement, leans into a drive to cover
punches from outside off towards mid-on
short over middle and leg, gets under it
good length, tails back in late from outside off, left alone
too wide to make him play
good length, keeps low on middle, defended
turned away with the angle to short leg.. lots of variable bounce now
short of a length outside off, defended off the backfoot
short ball that goes down leg as he ducks
another bouncer, this time over middle, ducked
short of a length, angled in, tucked away to square leg.. Latham gives it chase!
short ball, angled across and squaring him up as he shuffles and tries to defend
short of good length, nudges into the of side from the crease
short, pitching outside leg, nudged off the hips to backward square
lobs up off the shoulder as he takes his eyes off the ball, caught by the keeper diving forward
again shows his back to a short ball that climb no further than back high, pings him there
back of a length, cross-seamer, opens him up as he sticks the bat out
shortish, angled across off, punched to deep cover
short ball around middle, gets under it
tucks this off the hips to backward square leg
jumps up to a short ball and keeps it down, off the glove, I think
looks away from the direction of a short ball without ducking enough, bounces just over his helmet.. he's not looked comfortable against the short ball at all
and he jumps in his crease to keep it out towards short leg
full and swinging away from outside off to bring the two slips into play, left alone.
gets a good stride forward and defends this away-going delivery again.
shortens his length a hint, outside off, left alone
this one angles back in from wide of the crease, Kusal shapes to pull but is cramped for room, goes through with the stroke, no timing but gets it past square leg.
hops back into the crease and plays inside the line to let this short of length delivery to zip through.
sliding into the pads, this kept a touch low, but Mathews tickles this nicely towards fine leg for a couple.
squared up by the length but he manages to defend back somehow
gets forward to drive but checks his stroke at the last moment, goes on the bounce to cover.
ducks under this short ball outside leg, zips through to the keeper.
timed beautifully down the ground, showed the full face of the bat to rasp this away past mid-on. Looked to play it a lot straighter, but the result is the most-desired one.
bunts it away into the off side, this length delivery kept a touch low.
gets right on top of the bounce as he keeps out this short of length delivery.
pulls this into the leg side, but this short ball angled towards the body didn't bounce as high as he may have anticipated.
pulled all along the ground to fine leg, he's prepared to take on the short ball.
pulled all along the ground to deep square leg, got into position nice and early.
banged in short, way over the batsman's head as he leaves.
takes this on the body as Southee angles this short ball across from round the stumps
ducks under this short ball properly, was angled away in the hope of getting him to pull from outside off with fine leg and deep square in place. Mathews doesn't bite the bait.
driven down the ground beautifully. Angled in from round the stumps, ended up spraying it a touch too full. Perless drive back past the bowler and mid-on
slips one down leg in trying to target the ribcage
tucks this off his hips to deep fine leg for an easy single
squirts this off a thick outside edge towards gully.
smacked hard. Too short, got into position quickly and hammered the pull which hits Nicholls on the bounce at short leg. He doesn't show an iota of pain. Incredible!
pulled away again, this time there's protection in the deep to keep it to a single.
squirts this full delivery into the covers.
short ball from round the stumps, he ducks under it quite comfortably.
angles the short ball towards his hip, tucked to short fine leg.
right on top of the bounce as he turns this into the leg side. Played it with soft hands, showing good control to fend it away with no short leg in place.
short but outside off, Mathews ducks under it
square driven into the gap at point, just reached out to this delivery, opened the bat face slightly to lace this into the gap
uppish drive, straight to cover
Patel caught napping as he ambles after this punch at mid-off, may have erred there. Two runs when there should've been none
nips back in off a length from outside off, defended solidly
short of length outside off, punched into the covers for a quick single, excellent running.
too short, way over Mathews head from over the wicket, avoided.
floats this full on off, defended with soft hands.
guess what? He starts off with a full delivery that tails away a hint, defended from the crease
short of length on middle and leg, hint of movement away, defended.
short ball outside leg, a real grunt as he let this rip, Kusal ducks under this without a hassle, almost as if he was expecting it

wrists this magnificently to the mid-on boundary, purred away like a tracer bullet. This was slanted full, Kusal could've played this through mid-off too but his wrist work and instincts took over as he played this to the other side. Stunning stroke, high quality
uppish, just wide of Wagner but this races away, wonder if the bowler got some hand on it. This was struck really hard. They'll take three though. Nah, this wasn't as close to Wagner as it seemed.
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends back.
plays this short-arm jab to square leg.
shapes back in full from outside off, Kusal solidly defends with a straight bat
pokes at a delivery that slants across, lovely shape on this.
right behind the line of this full delivery as he turns this into the leg side.
uppish but he'll get this past Williamson, who gets a hand at gully to stop the pace. Squirts towards square third man
short of length delivery that nips away off the seam, left alone.
pulled away down to fine leg, nicely controlled.
another short ball, although this one doesn't bounce as much as the batsman expects. But he found out only after ducking under it, just bounced over the stumps.
turns this off his hip wide of short leg.

pulled all along the ground to the deep square leg region, controlled it superbly. The infielder ran across all the way to pull it back, but it <s> may have just touched the rope as he made contact with the rope. </s> Sliding effort from de Grandhomme. Wow, actually he's done alright there as replays confirm.
right on top of the ball as he defends.
pulled imperiously from outside off, beat de Grandhomme running back from square leg. Got right on top of the bounce, superb control.
away-going length delivery, bunted into the covers.
shows the full face of the bat to defend this full delivery, but was sitting back expecting the short ball perhaps.
punched on the up to mid-off.
slips this full delivery down leg, through to the keeper.
right across Mathews, who bunts this back down the pitch
slants a length delivery across, this keeps a touch low but he manages to stay behind the line and defend.
very nice from Kusal. This is a short ball directed at his ribcage, but he hops back to get out of the way and tickle it nicely towards fine leg. Excellent work by Boult too

pulled and he fetches this from outside off. All along the ground as he rolled his wrists superbly over the ball. This is a fine, fine counter-attack. The short-ball tactic isn't working at the moment, but as a bowler, Wagner shouldn't be too worried for it keeps him in the game
this is even better, this is floated full and Mendis with a full forward press as he belts this back past the bowler and mid-off. Shot of the morning, he's truly a delight to watch when in full flow.
gets carried away! Chases a full and wide delivery angling away, beaten on the drive.
ducks under this short ball, way over his head. Wide called.
steep bouncer, he looked to hook but bailed out at the last moment. Zippy bouncer from Wagner. He's now induced two mistakes from Kusal.
tucks this off his hip into the gap at square leg.
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone
short of length, jags away from the fourth-stump line, left alone.
solidly defended back towards mid-on.
tempts him with a drive by bowling this full outside off, left alone.
full outside off, left alone.
nips away from outside off, left alone again.
pulled imperiously to deep square
leaves a full delivery angling away
bouncer that sails over the keeper's head, wide called. Watling brought out the leap but there was no way he was going to reach this.
full and slanting away, left alone
pulled all along the ground, bisects square leg and midwicket, they'll hare back for the third.
sways out of the way of this short ball outside off.
looking to avoid but this doesn't bounce high but he manages to look away and avoid.
right forward as he bunts this into the off side.
punched to mid-off
hint of width outside off, left alone.
stands tall and punches this back towards the bowler.
pulled but got this high on the bat, straight to square leg.
turns this full delivery into the leg side with soft hands.
short, bit of width, leans back and opens up for a punch through point
good length, comes on straight outside off, left alone
length, too wide outside off to make him play
short of good length outside off, gets up on the toes and jabs it back to the bowler
good length, angles in from wide of the crease, Mendis knows his off stump and shoulders arms
good length, angled in, turned away to midwicket
